text: Baccharis pteronioides is a North American shrub in the aster family known by the common name Yerba de pasmo.Flora of North America, Yerba de pasmo Baccharis pteronioides de Candolle in A. P. de Candolle and A. L. P. P. de Candolle, Prodr. 5: 410. 1836. It is widespread in Mexico (from Chihuahua to Oaxaca)García-Mendoza, A. J. & J. A. Meave. 2011. CONABIO, México D.F.. and also found in the southwestern United States (Arizona, New Mexico, western Texas).Biota of North America Program 2014 county distribution map Baccharis pteronioides is a shrub up to 100 cm (40 inches) tall, with thick, leathery leaves and many small flower heads.
